Table of Contents

Interface IRssFeedParser

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.RssFeedParser
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Defines the operations required to download, clean, and parse RSS/Atom feeds. Provides methods for initial feed discovery and incremental article retrieval.

public interface IRssFeedParser

Remarks

This interface abstracts the RSS/Atom parsing logic from the rest of the application, allowing for pluggable implementations (e.g., different feed parsers, syndication libraries, or future enhancements like OPML support or full-text extraction).

Implementations must ensure: - Robust HTTP handling (timeouts, redirects, compression, user-agent). - Proper feed detection (RSS 1.0/2.0, Atom, RDF, JSON Feed fallback if possible). - Sanitization of HTML content (XSS prevention, relative URLs to absolute). - Duplicate detection (GUID, content hash, link). - Efficient memory usage (streaming parsing, avoid loading entire feed in RAM). - Cancellation support for long-running operations. - Proper exception handling and logging of feed-specific errors.

Methods

GenerateReaderViewHtmlAsync(Article, CancellationToken)

Generates a clean, ad-free HTML "Reader View" from an article's content or summary.

Task<string> GenerateReaderViewHtmlAsync(Article article, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

article Article

The article to generate reader view for.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<string>

A standalone HTML document suitable for loading in WebView2.

Remarks

This method produces a standalone HTML document that: - Removes scripts, styles, ads, trackers, and unnecessary markup - Preserves readable structure (headings, paragraphs, images, links) - Uses simple, responsive CSS for clean presentation - Is fully offline-capable (no external resources)

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if article is null.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled.

ParseArticlesAsync(string, int, CancellationToken)

Parses only new or updated articles from an existing feed URL.

Task<List<Article>> ParseArticlesAsync(string url, int feedId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

url string

The absolute URL of the RSS/Atom feed.

feedId int

The database ID of the existing feed.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<List<Article>>

A list of new or updated Article items ready for insertion/update.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if url is null or empty.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if feedId is less than or equal to 0.

HttpRequestException

Thrown on network or HTTP errors.

XmlException

Thrown on parsing failures.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled.

ParseFeedAsync(string, CancellationToken)

Parses a complete RSS/Atom feed from the given URL, extracting both feed metadata and initial articles.

Task<(Feed feed, List<Article> articles)> ParseFeedAsync(string url, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

url string

The absolute URL of the RSS/Atom feed.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<(Feed feed, List<Article> articles)>

A tuple containing the parsed Feed metadata and the list of initial Article items.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if url is null or empty.

ArgumentException

Thrown if url is not a valid absolute URI.

HttpRequestException

Thrown on network or HTTP errors.

XmlException

Thrown on XML parsing failures.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled.
